title.en: Introduction to Doctoral Studies in Science and Technology

structural_unit_name.en: Dean's Office, Faculty of Science and Technology

description.en: The course begins with the information day organized by the Centre for Doctoral Studies. The following lectures and seminars introduce the aims and organization of doctoral studies at the University of Tartu, planning one's studies, annual review, types of theses (article thesis and monograph), sources and databases, reference management tools, project-based research, writing and publishing research texts, conference culture, and principles of Open Science.
description.et: Õppeaine algab doktoriõppe keskuse korraldatava infopäevaga. Järgnevate loengute ja seminaride käigus tutvutakse doktoriõpingute korralduse ja eesmärkidega TÜs, doktoriõpingute planeerimisega, atesteerimisega, väitekirjade liikide (artikliväitekiri ja monograafia), andmeallikate ja -baasidega, viitehaldussüsteemidega, projektipõhise teaduse toimimisega, teadusliku teksti koostamise ja publitseerimisega, konverentside tavade, andmete ja avatud teaduse põhimõtetega.

objectives.en: The course introduces first-year PhD students to the aims and organization of doctoral studies at the University of Tartu, planning their studies, annual review, types of theses (article thesis and monograph), sources and databases, reference management tools, project-based research, writing and publishing research texts, conference culture, and principles of Open Science.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on anda esimese aasta doktorantidele ülevaade doktoriõpingute korraldusest ja eesmärkidest Tartu Ülikoolis (TÜ), doktoriõpingute planeerimisest, atesteerimisest, doktoritöö liikidest, andmeallikatest ja -baasidest, viitehaldussüsteemidest, projektipõhise teaduse toimimisest, teadusliku teksti koostamisest ja publitseerimisest, konverentside tavadest, andmetest ja avatud teaduse põhimõtetest.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, PhD students
-understand documents regulating doctoral studies and the good practice of doctoral studies and research
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab doktoriõpet reguleerivaid õigusakte ning doktoriõppe ja teaduse hea tava põhimõtteid

learning_outcomes.en: -can purposefully plan their doctoral studies and subsequent (academic) careers and set achievable aims
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab doktoriõpinguid ja järgnevat (teadlas)karjääri sihipäraselt planeerida ja teostatavaid eesmärke seada

learning_outcomes.en: -know and use leading publications in their discipline and understand the principles of classifying publications
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb ja kasutab valdkonna juhtivaid väljaandeid ning publikatsioonide klassifitseerimispõhimõtteid

learning_outcomes.en: -can plan the publication of a research article, among other things using skills necessary for reviewing in this process
learning_outcomes.et: - kavandab teadusliku artikli publitseerimist, kasutades selles protsessis, s.h retsenseerimises vajalikke oskusi

learning_outcomes.en: -systematically use research databases and reference management tools in their research
learning_outcomes.et: - rakendab oma töös sihipäraselt teadustööd koondavaid ja reguleerivaid andmebaase ning viitehaldusprogramme

learning_outcomes.en: -understand the operation of project-based and Open Science and plan their work in accordance with their requirements.
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab, kuidas toimib projektipõhine teadus ja avatud teadus (Open Science) ning kujundab oma tegevust selle vajadustega vastavalt

debt_elimination.et: Kokkuleppel vastutava õppejõuga on võimalik esitada kohustuslikke töid hiljem kuni semestri lõpuni.

description.et:
Information Day. 
1. Greetings - Johann Langemets, Vice Dean for Research of Faculty of Science and Technology  
2. Doctoral students' information channels. Graduate schools - Indrek Jõgi, Programme Director for Chemical and Physical Sciences
3. Planning your doctoral studies. Individual study plan, period plan, expectation list - Tarmo Tamm, Programme Director for Engineering and Technology
4. Doctoral students' progress review, assessment of research - Alar Rosentau, Programme Director for Life and Earth Sciences
5. Organisation of study (nominal period of study, following the curriculum, recognition of prior learning, studies abroad) - Johann Langemets, Programme Director for Mathematics and Computer Science
6. Course "Introduction to Doctoral Studies in Science and Technology" - Maris Hindrikson, Head of the Centre of Doctoral Studies of Faculty of Science and Technology

1. PhD student's learning journey application (TEEK) Monika Tasa. 

2. First steps as doctoral student in the Faculty of Science and Technology.The basic legal instruments governing doctoral studies at the University of Tartu. Good practices of doctoral studies, and supervising. (Maris Hindrikson)
Basic introduction to international multidisciplinary research databases (Web of Science; Scopus; Google Scholar) and Estonian Research Information System (ETIS). Basic bibliometrics. (Kalmer Lauk)
Introduction to academic databases. Google Scholar. (Svea Kaseorg)

Research ethics: protection of human subjects, animals and personal data.
(Mari-Liisa Parder)
Everyday tools for staying on top of your research topic. (Johann Langemets)
Open Science; Research data; FAIR data; Research data lifecycle; Data Management Plan (DMP); Data repositories; Data sharing and publishing; Data search. (Tiiu Tarkpea)
Project-based science. Structure of Estonian science. (Indrek Jõgi)

1. What makes a good scientific publication? Peer-reviewing in science. (Tarmo Tamm) 

2. Publishing in academic journals in Science and Technology. Top journals in the field. Problematic journals and publishing houses.
 (Maarja Öpik, Alar Rosentau)
Do I want to prevent (academic) burnout? (Kadri Jurs and Tõnu Jürjen)
